IndustryType: Production and manufacturing of pulp and paper

Title: Workers were exposed to malodorous gases at the Pulp Mill after an explosion occurred at the production plant’s concentrated malodorous gases collection system
LessonsLearned:
<font size="3"> </font><font size="2"><font><span><u><i>In order to prevent similar accidents, the investigation team recommends
the following measures. </i></u></span><span lang="FI"><u><i>The recommendations are general,
concerning the entire industry.</i></u> </span> </font></font><ol style="list-style-type: decimal; direction: ltr"><li style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span><font size="2">Equipment
that have been added to ensure the safety of the process must be placed so that
their visual inspection and maintenance can be performed safely. Safety equipment
and devices should preferably have appropriate indicators or be connected to
the automation system so that their actuation can be detected.</font></span></li><li style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span><font>The
reasons for the actuation of the safety devices/equipment must be identified.
Running the production against the safety controls must not be accepted as a
normal procedure. </font></span></li><li style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span><font>The risks
related to the aging of equipment must be assessed. Special attention must be paid
to process safety critical devices and their preventive maintenance, condition
inspections and need for renewal.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></font></span></li><li style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span><font>The operator
must ensure that the workers are aware of the hazards of different tasks and
work areas as well as the related safety and work instructions. The
instructions must include procedures on how to bring the process back into a
safe state after a fault situation. Management must go through the essential
safety instructions with the workers and supervise that instructions are
followed. </font></span></li><li style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span><font>Adequate
communication between shifts must be ensured. Appropriate shift change and
communication methods must be defined for operator-based maintenance workers.</font></span></li><li style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span><font>Operator-based
maintenance workers must receive sufficient guidance concerning the work area
and the tasks, including related hazards, before starting the work. </font></span></li><li style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span><font>Liabilities
and obligations concerning activities performed after fault situations
(including shutdowns and startups) must be clearly defined. </font></span></li><li style="color: black; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span style="color: black"><font>Management of change must also include
the assessment of the safety effects of smaller changes. The up-to-dateness of
risk analyses, instructions and P&amp;ID must be checked regularly. </font></span></li><li style="color: black; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span style="color: black"><font>The maintenance responsibilities for
installations that are situated across several departments and units must be
clearly defined.</font></span></li><li style="color: black; font-size: 11pt; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal"><span><font>Also when handling and storing chemicals that
are formed during the production process, regulations and guidance concerning
the handling and storage of hazardous chemicals must be followed. </font></span></li></ol><font><font><font><font size="3"> </font><span style="color: black; line-height: 115%; font-family: ">Internal
audits and inspections must also take into account the failure mechanisms of process
safety critical systems as well as procedures for corrective actions concerning
fault situations, including the responsibilities and tasks of the operating and
maintenance staff.</span></font></font></font><font><font><font><span style="color: black; line-height: 115%; font-family: "></span></font></font></font><font><font><font><span style="color: black; line-height: 115%; font-family: "><b></b></span></font></font></font><b><font><font><font><span style="color: black; line-height: 115%; font-family: "><u><strong>New in Tukes</strong></u></span></font></font></font></b><strong><b><b><font><font><font><b>: A short video "What was learnt" in Finnish. </b></font></font></font><b><font><font><font><span style="color: black; line-height: 115%; font-family: ">We have prepared also a slide show and a bulletin. </span></font></font></font></b><b><font><font><font><span style="color: black; line-height: 115%; font-family: "></span></font></font></font><font><font><font><span style="color: black; line-height: 115%; font-family: ">See: <a href="http://www.tukes.fi/fi/Ajankohtaista/Tiedotteet/Kemikaalilaitosten-ja--varastojen-turvallisuus/Hajukaasujarjestelman-kunnossapidon-puutteet-syyna-Kemin-Veitsiluodon-sellutehtaan-onnettomuuteen/">http://www.tukes.fi/fi/Ajankohtaista/Tiedotteet/Kemikaalilaitosten-ja--varastojen-turvallisuus/Hajukaasujarjestelman-kunnossapidon-puutteet-syyna-Kemin-Veitsiluodon-sellutehtaan-onnettomuuteen/</a></span></font></font></font></b></b></b></strong>

Reasons.ItemDescription: Substances involved: greater than 5% of quantity in Column 3 of Annex I
Injury to persons: >= 1 fatalities, >= 6 hospitalizing injuries etc.
Immediate damage to the environment (according to Annex VI)

AccidentDescription: An explosion occurred at the production plant’s concentrated malodorous gases collection system on November 7th, 2016, at 3:14 am. The workers were exposed to concentrated malodorous gases at 7:26 am when they were changing damaged rupture discs.

ADFireMajors.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADFireInitiating.ItemDescription: pool fire (burning pool of liquid, contained or uncontained)
jet flame (burning jet of fluid from orifice)
flash fire (burning vapour cloud, subsonic flame front)
fireball (burning mass rising in air, often after BLEVE)

ADExplosionMajors.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

ADExplosionInitiating.ItemDescription: rapid phase-transition explosion (rapid change of state)
VCE (vapour cloud explosion; supersonic wave front)

Site_Description:
<font><font><font><font><font size="1"><font size="1"><font><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: ">Veitsiluoto
Mill in Kemi is an integrated production facility manufacturing office papers,
coated mechanical papers and sawn products. </span><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: " lang="EN">Annual
production capacity of three paper machines, pulp mill, ground-wood mill, saw
mill and sheeting plant is 810,000 tonnes of office and coated magazine papers.
Saw mill’s capacity is ca. 160,000m<sup>3</sup>. Pulp mill’s yearly production
of 375,000 tonnes is used as raw material for office papers. Veitsiluoto Mill
employs about 1,000 people, of which around 620 are employed by Stora Enso.</span></font></font></font></font></font></font></font><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: " lang="EN"></span><br>
Installation_Description:
<font size="3"> </font><span><font size="2">An explosion occurred at the production plant’s
concentrated malodorous gases collection system. The collection system was
built in 1989. Malodorous gases are collected from different parts of the
process and burned in recovery boiler. Rupture discs and water locks are used
for the overpressure protection. </font></span><font size="3"> </font><br>

SiteProcessMajors.ItemDescription: heat exchanger (boiler, refrigerator, heating coils, etc.

SiteProcessInitiating.ItemDescription: heat exchanger (boiler, refrigerator, heating coils, etc.

SiteTransportMajors.ItemDescription: packaging (bagging, cylinder filling, drum filling, etc.)

SiteTransportInitiating.ItemDescription: packaging (bagging, cylinder filling, drum filling, etc.)

Description:
<span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: ">Concentrated malodorous gases contain hydrogen
sulphide, other sulphuric compounds, methanol and turpentine. According to the
safety data sheet of Stora Enso, malodorous gases are extremely flammable (H220), fatal
if inhaled (H330) and toxic if swallowed (H301) or in contact with skin (H331).</span>

SubstanceClassification.ItemDescription: 09 i. DANGEROUS FOR THE ENVIRONMENT - R50
09 ii. DANGEROUS FOR THE ENVIRONMENT - R51,R53

H2. ACUTE TOXIC  cat. 2 or 3 (n. 7)
H3. STOT SPECIFIC TARGET ORGAN TOXICITY
P1a. EXPLOSIVES, unastable or div. 1.1,1.2,1.3,1.5,1.6 or method A.14 (n. 8)
P1b. EXPLOSIVES div 1.4 (n. 8 and 10)
P2. FLAMMABLE GASES cat. 1 or 2

P3b. FLAMMABLE AEROSOLS (n. 11.1)  cat. 1 or 2 w/o flammable gases or liquids

P8. OXIDISING LIQUIDS AND SOLIDS

O2. Substances/mixtures emitting flammable gases with water

00. NAMED SUBSTANCE
No substances

Causes_Description:
<font size="3"> </font><span><font size="3">The explosion occurred when air entered the
system through a dried water lock. The explosive air-gas mixture was probably
ignited due to static electricity. Several explosions had occurred in the same
system during 2016. Most of the earlier events had only damaged rupture discs
that were used for overpressure protection, but an explosion on June 29th had
caused more significant material damages. The explosions had led to decisions
about corrective actions but on November 7th some of them had not yet been
fully implemented. </font></span><span><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: ">The accident investigation identified deficiencies in
both the state of the concentrated malodorous gases collection system and procedures
related to maintenance work.</span></span><span><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: "><br></span><br></span><font size="3"> </font>

CausesHumans.ItemDescription: operator health (includes ailments, intoxication, death, etc.)
wilful disobedience/failure to carry out duties

CausesExternals.ItemDescription: utilities failure (electricity, gas, water, steam air, etc.)

Consequence_Description: <span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: " calibri","sans-serif";="" font-size:="" 11pt;="" mso-fareast-font-family:="" calibri;="" mso-bidi-font-family:="" "times="" new="" roman";="" mso-ansi-language:="" en-us;="" mso-fareast-language:="" mso-bidi-language:="" ar-sa;"="">One worker was admitted to the hospital. Two workers were under observation for some hours in the hospital. Two workers got first aid at the site. <span title="Prosessi oli käynnissä uudelleen klo 13.07.">The process was running again at 13.07 after maintance work.</span></span><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: " calibri","sans-serif";="" font-size:="" 11pt;="" mso-fareast-font-family:="" calibri;="" mso-bidi-font-family:="" "times="" new="" roman";="" mso-ansi-language:="" en-us;="" mso-fareast-language:="" mso-bidi-language:="" ar-sa;"=""><span title="Prosessi oli käynnissä uudelleen klo 13.07."></span></span><span style="line-height: 115%; font-family: " calibri","sans-serif";="" font-size:="" 11pt;="" mso-fareast-font-family:="" calibri;="" mso-bidi-font-family:="" "times="" new="" roman";="" mso-ansi-language:="" en-us;="" mso-fareast-language:="" mso-bidi-language:="" ar-sa;"=""><span style="line-height: 115%; font-size: 12pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 25.0pt;" lang="FI"><font style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 0);"></font></span><br></span>
